title: Honoring North Korean Heritage

meta.description: Explore the rich cultural heritage of North Korea through art, history, language, and music.

pavilion_description: A serene space for reflection and cultural appreciation.
info_panel_content: Discover the rich cultural heritage of North Korea, from its traditional arts to modern achievements.

timeline.title: Key Moments in North Korean History

1945.title: Liberation from Japanese Rule
1945.description: Korea gains independence from Japan after World War II.

1948.title: Establishment of DPRK
1948.description: The Democratic People's Republic of Korea is officially established.

1972.title: New Constitution
1972.description: A new constitution is adopted, emphasizing self-reliance and socialism.

2011.title: Leadership Transition
2011.description: Kim Jong-un becomes the leader of North Korea.

2018.title: Inter-Korean Summit
2018.description: Historic summit between North and South Korean leaders.

chollima.name: Chollima
chollima.description: A mythical winged horse symbolizing speed and progress.

kimIlSung.name: Kim Il-sung Flower
kimIlSung.description: A hybrid begonia symbolizing the eternal leadership of Kim Il-sung.

juche.name: Juche Tower
juche.description: A monument representing the ideology of self-reliance.

jucheTower.name: Juche Tower
jucheTower.description: A 170-meter tall tower in Pyongyang, symbolizing the Juche ideology.

kimIlSungSquare.name: Kim Il-sung Square
kimIlSungSquare.description: The main city square of Pyongyang, used for military parades and mass gatherings.

ryugyongHotel.name: Ryugyong Hotel
ryugyongHotel.description: A 105-story pyramid-shaped skyscraper in Pyongyang, also known as the 'Hotel of Doom'.

mansuHill.name: Mansu Hill Grand Monument
mansuHill.description: Large bronze statues of Kim Il-sung and Kim Jong-il, a popular site for paying respects.

chosonghwa.title: Chosonghwa (조선화)
chosonghwa.description: Traditional Korean painting style characterized by its use of ink and watercolors on paper or silk.

minhwa.title: Minhwa (민화)
minhwa.description: Korean folk art paintings that often depict symbols of good fortune, happiness, and prosperity.

ceramics.title: Goryeo Celadon
ceramics.description: Exquisite green-glazed pottery from the Goryeo Dynasty, known for its jade-like color and intricate inlay designs.
